Articles.Content:
I decided to make a ship close to the likes of Icarus 2 from the film Sunshine (2007) as best I could.

2774 Parts ~900 Tons 4 Launches All Stock

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Imgur Link If you would like to view it there.

Craft Files

Payload

Front Section

Mid Section

Aft Engine Section
Damn. Wow.
Damn! How did you get the middle bits to spin like that?
Sir, I am impressed.
This is crazy good. Excellent job!
Wow, thats insane. Building that shield on the front would have killed me!
That will make my PC explode, and I froze in astonishment when I saw this. Great recreation!

Damn! How did you get the middle bits to spin like that?

Probably used Rotatrons from Damned Robotics.

Probably used Rotatrons from Damned Robotics.

It's stock, so no damned robotics.

This is really amazing. I wish my comp could handle 2000+ parts because that's one of my favorite Sci-Fi movies. I hate to ask this because it would mean the death of a LOT of hard work, but... did you crash it into Kerbol? Anywho well done good sir, well done indeed.

/nod

Impressive.
Does it move?

Damn! How did you get the middle bits to spin like that?

The mast sits on a frame that is balanced in the center with rover wheels to keep it in place.

The rover wheels hold onto and rotate around a ring made of small cubic octagonal struts. The inner one might be unnecessary, but I put it there just in case. Thrust is applied from the small engines to start rotation after it is decoupled.

Edited August 6, 2013 by Napster

But wouldn't they break apart during warp?

Also, what is the Delta-V of that monster?

But wouldn't they break apart during warp?

Also, what is the Delta-V of that monster?

They break apart during warp if they are decoupled/undocked. This ship is mostly for looks but does actually fly, you would just load a quick save you had before decoupling to take it somewhere.

I don't know the Delta-V, I don't have any mods installed besides a hullcam mod for different camera angles sorry.
I am curious so what are your computer specs? And was it painfully lagging during docking of those huge things? I mean 2744 parts, wow.

This is really amazing. I wish my comp could handle 2000+ parts because that's one of my favorite Sci-Fi movies. I hate to ask this because it would mean the death of a LOT of hard work, but... did you crash it into Kerbol? Anywho well done good sir, well done indeed.

You do know there is such a thing as quick save, right? (and save file back up too)
sweet buttery jesus thats big! and there was me thinking i had reached a miles stone making my first eeloo and back craft...
Holy god of Kerbals. That is absolutely beautiful. I love you.
That thing, I migh as well give it a try at running, hope my 1000$ laptop can handle it. Can you share the save file?

Deorbit it!

And make pics!
The forward section and payload always seem to be bumping into each other when docking. Is the panels around the docking ring on the forward section supposed to be there?
This really is impressive, my computer is practically lagging just from looking at the pictures haha
I nearly had a heart attack when I saw the part count.
What kind of CPU do you have where you can handle all that?
